page.title: 06A MENDIP DAIRY FARM
page.content: Bristol Plain Farm is located on the Mendip plateau at a height of about 250 metres 2 miles from Cheddar. The farm extends to 290 acres and supports 262 cattle. Of these,130 are dairy cattle in milk,100 are followers for herd replacement,30 are reared for beef cattle and there are 2 bulls. Most of the cattle are Frisian as these yield the most milk. Each cow produces approximately 1000 gallons each year. The soil is a medium loam but is thin and stoney in many places so that much of the land is rough grazing. The high rainfall (approx.1250 millimetres per year) leaches nutrients from the soil so that fertilizer and lime applications are important for the production of quality grass.
